# Privacy Policy

**GitLab Time Tracker Chrome Extension**

_Last Updated: December 2025_

## Introduction

GitLab Time Tracker is a browser extension that helps you track time spent on GitLab issues. This privacy policy explains what data the extension collects, how it's stored, and how it's used.

## Data Collection

### Data You Provide

- **GitLab URL:** The URL of your GitLab instance
- **API Token:** Your GitLab Personal Access Token for authentication

### Data Generated by the Extension

- **Timer State:** Current timer status, start time, and associated issue
- **Task History:** List of issues you've tracked time on (up to 50 entries)
- **Favorites:** Issues you've marked as favorites

## Data Storage

**All data is stored locally on your device.**

- Data is stored using Chrome's `chrome.storage.local` API
- Data is NOT synced across devices
- Data is NOT sent to any external servers (except your own GitLab instance)
- Data is NOT shared with third parties

## Permissions

The extension requires the following permissions:

| Permission                  | Purpose                                                                       |
| --------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `storage`                   | Store your settings, timer state, and task history locally                    |
| `scripting`                 | Inject the timer button into GitLab issue pages                               |
| `tabs`                      | Detect when you navigate to GitLab pages                                      |
| `optional host permissions` | Connect to your GitLab instance API (only granted with your explicit consent) |

## Third-Party Services

The extension only communicates with:

- **Your GitLab Instance:** To log time entries via the GitLab API

The extension does NOT communicate with:

- Any analytics services
- Any advertising networks
- Any other third-party servers

## Data Security

- Your API token is stored locally and never transmitted except to your GitLab instance
- All communication with GitLab uses HTTPS
- The extension requests minimal permissions required for functionality
- Host permissions are optional and require explicit user consent

## Your Control

You have full control over your data:

- **View Data:** Check `chrome://extensions` → GitLab Time Tracker → Storage
- **Delete Data:** Uninstall the extension to remove all stored data
- **Revoke Permissions:** Remove host permissions via extension settings or Chrome settings

## Children's Privacy

This extension is not directed at children under 13 and does not knowingly collect personal information from children.

## Changes to This Policy

We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Any changes will be reflected in the "Last Updated" date above.

## Contact

If you have questions about this privacy policy, please open an issue on the project's GitHub repository.

## Summary

- All data stays on your device
- Only communicates with your GitLab instance
- No tracking, analytics, or ads
- You control your data
